title: Leicester news: Hamza Choudhury in 'good spirits' after suffering racial abuse
text:
Hamza Choudhury is said to be in good spirits despite suffering racial abuse over the weekend as Leicester continue talks with social media companies over the insults the midfielder suffered.

The 22-year-old held discussions with club officials after Monday's training session, while Leicester have also met representatives from Kick It Out.

The club reported the incident to Leicestershire Police after the match via their police liaison officer, and have guaranteed Choudhury he will receive all the support he requires as the matter is investigated.

Hamza Choudhury is said to be in good spirits despite suffering racial abuse over the weekend

Every effort will be made to identify and punish those who abused Choudhury, though such investigations are sometimes complicated if the users are based outside the United Kingdom.

Kick It Out have already warned time is 'running out' to take measures to protect players from racist abuse online.

A statement released by the charity read: 'The time for talking is fast running out and if action will not be taken, the Government or a regulatory body must intervene and force these platforms to adopt measures to eradicate abuse, identify perpetrators and hold them to account.

'After yesterday's Premier League fixture between @LFC and @LCFC, Hamza Choudhury became the latest player to receive horrendous racist abuse, via a number of social media platforms and in the comments section of several online articles.

'Despite ongoing discussions about tacking this ever-increasing issue, we have yet to see any concrete measures put in place to protect the players suffering this abuse.'
description: Hamza Choudhury is said to be in good spirits despite suffering racial abuse over the weekend as Leicester continue talks with social media companies over the insults the midfielder suffered.
